page.title: 13Barby Cricket Club
page.content: The present Cricket Club was reformed in 1972. It joined the Midweek Advertiser League in 1973, gained rapid promotion and reached the final of the Advertiser Cup in 1982, winning the Indoor League in 1985. The Club has joined the South Leicestershire League this year. League Cricket has ensured a high standard of play and great competition amongst villagers for team selection. In 1975 the ladies and junior sections were formed. The ladies play about 20 matches each season, some are cricket matches, others are tip and run. The juniors are more competitive winning the Daventry and District under 16's in 1977, were finalists in 1981 and semi-finalists in the Avon Cup under 15's in 1985. The Club has built it's own pavilion and organises many social events as well as an annual wards night
